snippet: A court found that no Egyptian documents proved Hazem Salah Abu Ismail’s mother was a United States citizen, but the election commission will have the final say.
abstract: Egyptian court unexpectedly declines to disqualify Hazem Salah Abu Ismail, an ultraconservative Islamist, from running for president because of his mother’s status as an American citizen; court ruled in his favor because Interior Ministry was unable to produce any official Egyptian documents confirming her status.
lead_paragraph: A court found that no Egyptian documents proved Hazem Salah Abu Ismail’s mother was a United States citizen, but the election commission will have the final say.
